intro: Polyadenia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
